in my github project, i have a configs.json file that helps the user define the prompts they would like to use in their program. How can I ignore this file so that the default prompt stays the same on git commits?

To ignore the `configs.json` file so that changes to it won't be tracked in git commits, you can add it to the `.gitignore` file in your project's root directory. 

If you don't have a `.gitignore` file yet, you can create one. Within the `.gitignore` file, simply add a line with the filename `configs.json`. This will tell Git to ignore any changes or additions to that file.

If you're using the command line, you can navigate to your project's directory and run these commands:
```bash
echo "configs.json" >> .gitignore
```

If you prefer to do this through a text editor, simply open up a text editor, create a file called `.gitignore` in your project's root directory, and insert the line `configs.json` in it.

Once you've added the filename to your `.gitignore` file, any changes you make to `configs.json` won't be tracked in future commits.
